oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Practical on-farm biosecurity
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lee, Molly Jean
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: biosecurity
disease
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This manuscript will cover practical approaches to biosecurity on the farm. Biosecurity practices based on route of disease transmission will be emphasized, as well as a review of basic principles of biosecurity. Biosecurity principles commonly de­scribed as “everyday” and “enhanced” will be summarized in a practical, succinct way. Additional discussion on biosecurity risks, barriers and strategies will occur, and resources on help­ing veterinarians help their clients create a site-specific bios­ecurity plan, as well as related topic-specific resources like dis­infection, will be shared.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; No. 59 (2025): 2025 Recent Graduate Conference Proceedings; 71-73
